ygData.subject: er
ygData.msgSnippet: xilith, the soulfire really ISNT a very good weapon. in fact its pretty crappy once you get past the eye candy part. sure the stats are NICE, but by the time
ygData.messageBody:
xilith, the soulfire really ISNT a very good weapon. in fact its pretty
crappy once you get past the eye candy part. sure the stats are NICE, but by
the time you can actually obtain one without a major twink job, and
considering a paladin who wants it more or less has to continue the quest
through most of his paladin career, it is just complete junk when set beside
a mithril 2h sword or a razing sword of skarlton. yes i know those two
weapons are very difficult to obtain, but there is a big difference between
several hours of camping and several months of active questing :) which does
kind of confuse me.. since it is one of the hardest weapons in the game to
obtain (not to mention limited to a specific class) why is it so chintzy?
not asking for an answer, just a not so subtle suggestion that any sk quest
swords be made a bit more utilitarian ;)

Beld Demonblade
Fennin Ro
